{"step_by_step_thinking": "In clinical gingivitis, there is inflammation of the gingiva (gums) due to plaque accumulation. Radiographic findings in gingivitis are usually limited to changes in the soft tissues rather than the bone. Therefore, the most likely radiographic finding in clinical gingivitis would be a normal bone pattern, as there is no significant bone loss or changes in bone density. ", "answer_choice": "B"}
